form.official-title: To amend the Water Resources Reform and Development Act of 2014 to improve provisions relating to the development of hydropower at Corps of Engineers facilities, and for other purposes.

section.header: Expediting hydropower at Corps of Engineers facilities
section.text: Section 1008 of the Water Resources Reform and Development Act of 2014 (33 U.S.C. 2321b) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(1), by inserting and to meet the requirements of subsection (b) after projects;
by redesignating subsections (b) and (c) as subsections (c) and (d), respectively;
by inserting after subsection (a) the following:
ensure that the policy described in section (a) is implemented nationwide in an efficient, consistent, and coordinated manner; and

subparagraph.text: to increase the development of hydroelectric power at existing hydroelectric water resources development projects of the Corps of Engineers; and
to develop new hydroelectric power at nonpowered water resources development projects of the Corps of Engineers.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Program manager for non-Federal hydroelectric power development

paragraph.text: The Chief of Engineers shall designate an employee of the Corps of Engineers as a Program Manager for Non-Federal Hydroelectric Power Development (referred to in this subsection as the Program Manager).

subparagraph.text: not be otherwise involved in the review of any Corps of Engineers permit to develop hydroelectric power at Corps of Engineers civil works projects; and
be located at the headquarters office of the Corps of Engineers.

paragraph.text: With respect to the development of non-Federal hydroelectric power at Corps of Engineers civil works projects, the Program Manager shall—

subparagraph.text: ensure timely and consistent review of permits across Corps of Engineers districts and levels;
answer questions within the Corps of Engineers, or facilitate communication between developers and the Corps of Engineers, concerning Corps of Engineers permits;
answer questions from developers regarding the permitting process of the Corps of Engineers;
coordinate with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission on licensing matters;
facilitate timely action on all aspects of Federal permitting required for hydropower development; and
ensure that new hydropower productions are designed and operated with environmentally sustainable technologies and management plans.

paragraph.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Chief of Engineers shall submit to Congress a report on the implementation of this subsection and subsection (b).
